lessons.japanese: 偉い人は身なりを気にしない。
lessons.english: A great man doesn't care about his appearance.

lessons.japanese: その身なりでは人前に出られません。
lessons.english: You're not fit to be seen.

lessons.japanese: こんな身なりで外出するのは気が引ける。
lessons.english: I'm ashamed to go out dressed like this.

lessons.japanese: この店ではちゃんとした身なりをしなさい。
lessons.english: You are expected to dress well for this shop.

lessons.japanese: きちんとした身なりをしていられないほど貧しい人はいない。
lessons.english: No one is so poor that he cannot afford to be neat.

lessons.japanese: 貧しい身なりをしているからといって人を軽蔑するな。
lessons.english: Don't despise a man because he is poorly dressed.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は身なりをかまわない。
lessons.english: She is very negligent in her dress.

lessons.japanese: 彼は身なりは立派だが、紳士などではない。
lessons.english: He is well dressed, but he is anything but a gentleman.

lessons.japanese: 彼の身なりは紳士だが、言葉や行いはいなか者だ。
lessons.english: His dress is that of a gentleman, but his speech and behavior are those of a clown.

lessons.japanese: 身なりなんか気にしていません。
lessons.english: She is regardless of her appearance.

lessons.japanese: 身なりが貧しいからというだけで人を軽蔑するな。
lessons.english: Don't despise a man just because he is poorly dressed.
